note.p: Career: Obtained a Commission in the British Army (1710); MP for Haslemere, Surrey (1722); sailed with 120 settlers to Georgia and founded the town of Savannah (1732); General (1743); served against the Jacobite rebels in Britain (1745); accused of misconduct by the Duke of Cumberland, court martialled, was acquitted, but left the army; was a friend of Walpole, Goldsmith, Burke and Dr Johnson
Ejected for non-payment of arrears (09 June 1757)
